My wife's cat was very attached to her when we first started dating. He seemed very loving, sweet, and loved to be petted. She left the room leaving me and him alone together. As I reached to pet his head he jerked away, brought his claws out, and slowly started licking his paw while staring me down. My wife walked back in and he immediately became "Mr. Friendly" again.
My wife is nurse here in Seattle. She's met a few besides herself, but they keep it secret.
I had a friend who has domesticated pot belly pigs. They don't come in house but just hang around outside and like to play. I don't know if its common, but I feel like foxes could on a similar level.

Soft bigotry, it's a thing. I had some people tell me they were scared for me and my kids because we are Latino after Trump was elected.
"For one, I was born here. Two, if I wasn't born here I'd have come legally. Three, if I was in a country illegally I'd be scared too!"
This joke was toeriffic.

I had a friend in high school that was a genius. He had an almost perfect score on both the SAT and ACT. He was also a 4.0 student, volunteered for multiple charities, and participated in multiple extra-curricular activities. He applied for Stanford, and was rejected.
Two other people from the same class applied to Stanford. They had decent grades and a little above average SAT and ACT scores. They both applied to Stanford, and were personally flown from Alaska and given a personal tour.
Difference between the two examples? First guy was white and the other two people were Alaskan Native.

I was arrested but not charged a few years ago. Long story short I had ripped a door off its hinges and cracked a door frame. When the two female officers arrived I was calm and collected and willingly let them arrest me. As I put my arms behind my back I flexed my arms because it was uncomfortable. When I made that motion both officers tensed noticeably. I was confused and then realized, unless they used their guns their was absolutely no way the two of them could detain me if I struggled.
I understand why you want mixed gender police forces, but you have to make sure you keep high physical standards and maybe consider sending at least one of each gender on calls with potentially violent men.

I was always taught as a driver to imagine the stupidest thing the car/pedestrian could do and act accordingly. You would be surprised how often the stupidest thing happens, and I think brake checking falls in that category.

25 million killed by Stalin, and not a religious thought on his mind.
Any idea can be turned deadly if taken to the extreme, including atheism. Why don't we just focus on getting people in charge whose main goal isn't to eradicate everyone else and take over the world?
Thanks! That does make more sense.

WRITING.TITLE: Two Bald Eagles
WRITING.TEXT:
A bald eagle decides to stop by a small lake to get a drink. As he's drinking another bald eagle lands next to him.
He looks at the eagle and notices a tulip, a rose, and a rabbit's foot on top of his head.
"What's with the stuff on your head?", the eagle asks.
"Oh this?", he points to his head with his wing, "I'm trying hare in plants."
The entire sentence structure is strange. Not sending their best.

A few times, but it was with the same scrum master. Then she got promoted and it all went to heck.

I've had it both ways. Agile development with a good scrum master can produce a great product. But it has to be structured and have realistic deadlines.
I've also had managers that said, "We had the deadline moved up a month so now we are going to use Agile development to go faster."
No, no, that's not how any of this works.
Congratulations! Don't know if it is your first but if it is you are in for a wild ride!
That's absolutely amazing. Thanks for sharing!

Thanks. I searched using "Calvin Dad". I should have just used "Calvin" and I wouldn't have reposted.
[Wholesome Calvin and Hobbes](https://www.reddit.com/r/wholesomememes/comments/5yv84f/wholesome_calvin_and_hobbes/)
The greatness and simplicity of that comic was great. So many little things are important in being a parent.
One of my favorite things to do with his books was skim through and look for comics with little to no words and see how well he told the story. He truly was great at it.

My mom died unexpectedly 5 years ago, 3 days after the birth of my youngest child. Mom posts can be hard for me, but this one warmed my heart because it flooded me with memories of everything kind and wholesome she did for me.
Thank you.
